docs.snippet: The pastor of a black church in Flint, Michigan, stopped Donald Trump on Wednesday in the midst of his remarks criticizing Democratic rival Hillary Clinton, and said the Republican presidential nominee was not invited to talk about politics....
docs.lead_paragraph: The pastor of a black church in Flint, Michigan, stopped Donald Trump on Wednesday in the midst of his remarks criticizing Democratic rival Hillary Clinton, and said the Republican presidential nominee was not invited to talk about politics.

headline.main: Pastor Cuts Trump Short During Anti-Clinton Speech in Flint

headline.print_headline: Clinton Visits North Carolina in Campaign Trail Return; Trump Up in Polls

docs.snippet: Back on the campaign trail, a reflective Hillary Clinton said Thursday her three-day, doctor-mandated break gave her new perspective on why she's running to be president. She vowed to close her campaign against Donald Trump by giving Americans "so...
docs.lead_paragraph: Back on the campaign trail, a reflective Hillary Clinton said Thursday her three-day, doctor-mandated break gave her new perspective on why she's running to be president. She vowed to close her campaign against Donald Trump by giving Americans "something to vote for, not just against."

headline.main: Reflective Clinton Returns to Campaign Trail After Pneumonia
headline.print_headline: Reflective Clinton Returns to Campaign Trail After Pneumonia

docs.snippet: Disrupting the presidential election would be far easier than changing the outcome by computer hacking, officials say. But disruption may have already begun....
docs.lead_paragraph: Disrupting the presidential election would be far easier than changing the outcome by computer hacking, officials say. But disruption may have already begun.
docs.abstract: United States intelligence officials say that Russian hackers will be unable to change outcome of presidential election, but could do damage in form of sowing doubts about legitimacy of election's results; while US voting system's security is of particular concern, officials say fact that it is relatively antiquated and decentralized make it more resilient to hacking attacks than other government systems.

headline.main: Sowing Doubt Is Seen as Prime Danger in Hacking Voting System
headline.print_headline: Prime Danger in Vote Hack: Sowing Doubt

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and CHARLIE SAVAGE
